member.name: T:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.ImageFileFormat
member.summary: Represents the image file format types
member.remarks: The IFF_DEFAULT flag is used to write the file out in the same(input) file format that the pix was read from.If the pix was not read from file, the input format field will be IFF_UNKNOWN and the output file format will be chosen to be compressed and lossless; namely, IFF_TIFF_G4 for d = 1 and IFF_PNG for everything else. IFF_JP2 is for jpeg2000, which is not supported in leptonica.

member.name: T:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.Orientation
member.summary: Represents orientation
member.remarks:
Orientation Example: | 1 Aaaa Aaaa Aaaa | ==================== | Aaa aa aaa aa | To left is a diagram of some(1) English and | aaaaaa A aa aaa. | (2) Chinese text and a(3) photo credit. | 2 | | ####### c c C | Upright Latin characters are represented as A and a. | ####### c c c | '←' represents a latin character rotated | ← ####### c c c | anti-clockwise 90 degrees. | ← ####### c c | | ← ####### . c | Upright Chinese characters are represented C and c. | 3 ####### c | +------------------+ NOTA BENE: enum values here should match goodoc.proto
If you orient your head so that "up" aligns with Orientation, then the characters will appear "right side up" and readable.
In the example above, both the English and Chinese paragraphs are oriented so their "up" is the top of the page (page up). The photo credit is read with one's head turned leftward ("up" is to page left).

member.summary: Represents the possible modes for page layout analysis.

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageSegMode.PSM_OSD_ONLY
member.summary: Orientation and script detection only.

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageSegMode.PSM_AUTO_OSD
member.summary: Automatic page segmentation with orientation and script detection. (OSD)

member.summary: Automatic page segmentation, but no OSD, or OCR.

member.summary: Fully automatic page segmentation, but no OSD.

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageSegMode.PSM_SINGLE_COLUMN

member.summary: Assume a single uniform block of vertically aligned text.

member.summary: Assume a single uniform block of text. (Default.)

member.name: T:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.ParagraphJustification
member.summary: Represents paragraph justification

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.ParagraphJustification.JUSTIFICATION_UNKNOWN
member.summary: The alignment is not clearly one of the other options. This could happen for example if there are only one or two lines of text or the text looks like source code or poetry.

remarks.note: Fully justified paragraphs (text aligned to both left and right margins) are marked by Tesseract with JUSTIFICATION_LEFT if their text is written with a left-to-right script and with JUSTIFICATION_RIGHT if their text is written in a right-to-left script.
remarks.para: Interpretation for text read in vertical lines: "Left" is wherever the starting reading position is.

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.ParagraphJustification.JUSTIFICATION_LEFT
member.summary: Each line, except possibly the first, is flush to the same left tab stop.

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.ParagraphJustification.JUSTIFICATION_CENTER
member.summary: The text lines of the paragraph are centered about a line going down through their middle of the text lines.

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.ParagraphJustification.JUSTIFICATION_RIGHT
member.summary: Each line, except possibly the first, is flush to the same right tab stop.

member.name: T:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.TextlineOrder
member.summary: Represents the text lines are read in the given sequence.
member.remarks: In English, the order is top-to-bottom. In Chinese, vertical text lines are read right-to-left.Mongolian is written in vertical columns top to bottom like Chinese, but the lines order left-to right. Note that only some combinations make sense.For example, WRITING_DIRECTION_LEFT_TO_RIGHT implies TEXTLINE_ORDER_TOP_TO_BOTTOM

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.TextlineOrder.TEXTLINE_ORDER_LEFT_TO_RIGHT
member.summary: Left-to-right line order

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.TextlineOrder.TEXTLINE_ORDER_RIGHT_TO_LEFT
member.summary: Right-to-left line order

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.TextlineOrder.TEXTLINE_ORDER_TOP_TO_BOTTOM
member.summary: Top-to-bottom line order

member.name: T:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.WritingDirection
member.summary: The grapheme clusters within a line of text are laid out logically in this direction, judged when looking at the text line rotated so that its Orientation is "page up". For English text, the writing direction is left-to-right. For the Chinese text in the above example, the writing direction is top-to-bottom.

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.WritingDirection.WRITING_DIRECTION_LEFT_TO_RIGHT
member.summary: Left-to-rigth writing direction

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.WritingDirection.WRITING_DIRECTION_RIGHT_TO_LEFT
member.summary: Right-to-left writing direction

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.WritingDirection.WRITING_DIRECTION_TOP_TO_BOTTOM
member.summary: Top-to-bottom writing direction

member.name: T:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.OcrEngineMode
member.summary: Represents ocr engine mode
member.remarks: When Tesseract/Cube is initialized we can choose to instantiate/load/run only the Tesseract part, only the Cube part or both along with the combiner. The preference of which engine to use is stored in tessedit_ocr_engine_mode.

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.OcrEngineMode.OEM_TESSERACT_ONLY
member.summary: Run Tesseract only - fastest

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.OcrEngineMode.OEM_CUBE_ONLY
member.summary: Run Cube only - better accuracy, but slower

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.OcrEngineMode.OEM_TESSERACT_CUBE_COMBINED
member.summary: Run both and combine results - best accuracy

member.name: F:Patagames.Ocr.Enums.OcrEngineMode.OEM_DEFAULT
member.summary: Specify this mode when calling init_*(), to indicate that any of the above modes should be automatically inferred from the variables in the language-specific config, command-line configs, or if not specified in any of the above should be set to the default OEM_TESSERACT_ONLY.

member.name: T:Patagames.Ocr.OcrBoxTextRenderer
member.summary: Create BoxText Renderer interface for rendering tesseract results into a document
member.remarks:
This interface is then used to inject the renderer class into tesseract when processing images.
For simplicity implementing this with tesesract version 3.01, the renderer contains document state that is cleared from document to document just as the TessBaseAPI is. This way the base API can just delegate its rendering functionality to injected renderers, and the renderers can manage the associated state needed for the specific formats in addition to the heuristics for producing it.

member.param: Path to the output file without extension
member.returns: New instance of renderer. Throw exception if any errors occurs
member.exception: The renderer cannot be created for some reason.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrPageIterator.Next(Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageIteratorLevel)
member.summary: Moves to the start of the next object at the given level in the page hierarchy.

remarks.note: that RIL_SYMBOL will skip non-text blocks, but all other level values will visit each non-text block once. Think of non text blocks as containing a single para, with a single line, with a single imaginary word
remarks.para: Calls to Next with different levels may be freely intermixed.
This function iterates words in right-to-left scripts correctly, if the appropriate language has been loaded into Tesseract.

member.param: Type of element of the page hierarchy.
member.returns: False if the end of the page was reached.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrPageIterator.IsAtBeginningOf(Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageIteratorLevel)
member.summary: Check whether the iterator is at the start of an object at the given level
member.param: Type of element of the page hierarchy.
member.returns: true if the iterator is at the start of an object at the given level
member.remarks:
For instance, suppose an iterator it is pointed to the first symbol of the first word of the third line of the second paragraph of the first block in a page, then:
it.IsAtBeginningOf(RIL_BLOCK) = false it.IsAtBeginningOf(RIL_PARA) = false it.IsAtBeginningOf(RIL_TEXTLINE) = true it.IsAtBeginningOf(RIL_WORD) = true it.IsAtBeginningOf(RIL_SYMBOL) = true

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrPageIterator.IsAtFinalElement(Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageIteratorLevel,Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageIteratorLevel)
member.summary: Check whether the iterator is positioned at the last element in a given level. (e.g.the last word in a line, the last line in a block)
member.param: Type of element of the page hierarchy.
Type of element of the page hierarchy.
member.returns: true if the iterator is positioned at the last element in a given level

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrPageIterator.GetBoundingBox(Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageIteratorLevel)
member.summary: Gets bounding rectangle of the current object at the given level.
member.param: Type of element of the page hierarchy.
member.returns: Returns the bounding rectangle, or throw if there is no such object at the current position.
member.remarks: The returned bounding box is guaranteed to match the size and position of the image returned by , but may clip foreground pixels from a grey image.The padding argument to can be used to expand the image to include more foreground pixels. See for details.
member.exception: Thrown if there is no such object at the current position

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrPageIterator.GetBinaryImage(Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageIteratorLevel)
member.summary: Get f binary image of the current object at the given level.
member.param: Type of element of the page hierarchy.
member.returns: Binary image of the current object at the given level
member.remarks:
The position and size match the return from BoundingBoxInternal, and so this could be upscaled with respect to the original input image. The following methods are used to generate the images:
RIL_BLOCK: mask the page image with the block polygon. RIL_TEXTLINE: Clip the rectangle of the line box from the page image. TODO(rays) fix this to generate and use a line polygon. RIL_WORD: Clip the rectangle of the word box from the page image. RIL_SYMBOL: Render the symbol outline to an image for cblobs (prior to recognition) or the bounding box otherwise.
A reconstruction of the original image (using xor to check for double representation) should be reasonably accurate, apart from removed noise, at the block level.Below the block level, the reconstruction will be missing images and line separators. At the symbol level, kerned characters will be invade the bounding box if rendered after recognition, making an xor reconstruction inaccurate, but an or construction better.Before recognition, symbol-level reconstruction should be good, even with xor, since the images come from the connected components.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrPageIterator.GetImage(Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageIteratorLevel,System.Int32,Patagames.Ocr.OcrPix,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get an image of the current object at the given level in greyscale if available in the input.
member.param: Type of element of the page hierarchy.
Padding for original image. See remarks for detail.
If not null, then extract from the original image instead of the binary image.
member.returns: an image of the current object at the given level.
member.remarks:
To guarantee a binary image use .
NOTE that in order to give the best possible image, the bounds are expanded slightly over the binary connected component, by the supplied padding, so the top-left position of the returned image is returned in (left,top). These will most likely not match the coordinates returned by .
If you do not supply an original image, you will get a binary one.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrPageIterator.GetBaseLine(Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageIteratorLevel)
member.summary: Get the baseline of the current object at the given level.
member.param: Type of element of the page hierarchy.
member.returns: the baseline of the current object, or throw if there is no baseline at the current position.

remarks.note: with vertical text, baselines may be vertical!

member.exception: Thrown if there is no baseline at the current position.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrPageIterator.GetIteratorParams(Patagames.Ocr.Enums.Orientation@,Patagames.Ocr.Enums.WritingDirection@,Patagames.Ocr.Enums.TextlineOrder@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Get orientation for the block the iterator points to.
member.param: Text line order. See for details.
after rotating the block so the text orientation is upright, how many radians does one have to rotate the block anti-clockwise for it to be level? -Pi/4 ⇐ deskew_angle ⇐ Pi/4

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrPageIterator.GetParagraphInfo(Patagames.Ocr.Enums.ParagraphJustification@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get information about the current paragraph, if available.
member.param: LEFT if ragged right, or fully justified and script is left-to-right. RIGHT if ragged left, or fully justified and script is right-to-left. Unknown if it looks like source code or we have very few lines.
true if we believe this is a member of an ordered or unordered list.

true if the first line of the paragraph is aligned with the other lines of the paragraph even though subsequent paragraphs have first line indents.This typically indicates that this is the continuation of a previous paragraph or that it is the very first paragraph in the chapter.
member.remarks:
first line indent -
For LEFT aligned paragraphs, the first text line of paragraphs of this kind are indented this many pixels from the left edge of the rest of the paragraph.
for RIGHT aligned paragraphs, the first text line of paragraphs of this kind are indented this many pixels from the right edge of the rest of the paragraph.
This value may be negative. if is_crown == true, the first line of this paragraph is actually flush, and first_line_indent is set to the "common" first line indent for subsequent paragraphs in this block of text.

member.remarks: Greyscale of 8 and color of 24 or 32 bits per pixel may be given. Palette color images will not work properly and must be converted to 24 bit. Binary images of 1 bit per pixel may also be given but they must be byte packed with the MSB of the first byte being the first pixel, and a 1 represents WHITE. For binary images set bytes_per_pixel= 0. The data should be in bgr format.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrResultIterator.Next(Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageIteratorLevel)
member.summary: Moves to the start of the next object at the given level in the page hierarchy in the appropriate reading order.
member.param: Type of element of the page hierarchy.
member.returns: False if the end of the page was reached.

remarks.note: that RIL_SYMBOL will skip non-text blocks, but all other level values will visit each non-text block once. Think of non text blocks as containing a single para, with a single line, with a single imaginary word
remarks.para: Calls to Next with different levels may be freely intermixed.
This function iterates words in right-to-left scripts correctly, if the appropriate language has been loaded into Tesseract.

member.name: T:Patagames.Ocr.OcrResultRenderer
member.summary: The base interface for rendering tesseract results into a document, such as text, HOCR or pdf. This interface is then used to inject the renderer class into tesseract when processing images. For simplicity implementing this with tesesract version 3.01, the renderer contains document state that is cleared from document to document just as the is. This way the base API can just delegate its rendering functionality to injected renderers, and the renderers can manage the associated state needed for the specific formats in addition to the heuristics for producing it.

member.name: T:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi
member.summary: Base class for all tesseract APIs.

member.name: P:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets or sets license key. Null for trial mode.

member.name: P:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.PathToEngine
member.summary: Gets or sets path to the tesseract.dll. Null for automatic detection. See remarks sections for detail.

remarks.para: In some cases, library initializer can not find tesseract.dll library to load. A typical example of this situation is a Web application. Web apps is running in a IIS working directory, unlike the classical apps. As a consequence, standard LoadLibrary function can not find the dll during loading process.
In this case, you must explicitly specify the full path to the tesseract.dll file through this property.

The initialization algorithm is as follows:
Attempting to load dll from the path which received through PathToEngine property.
Attempting to load dll from x64 or x86 folder.Needed folder automatically detected by based the process compilation mode and operating system.
Attempting to load dll from the working directory of the process which call initialization.
Attempting to load dll from the same directory where placed assembly which call initialization.
Otherwise, initialization error.

Web apps is running in a IIS working directory, unlike the classical apps. As a consequence, standard LoadLibrary function can not find the dll during loading process.

The initialization algorithm is as follows:
Attempting to load dll from the path which received through property.
Attempting to load dll from x64 or x86 folder.Needed folder automatically detected by based the process compilation mode and operating system.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.Init(System.String,System.String,Patagames.Ocr.Enums.OcrEngineMode,System.String[],System.String[],System.String[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize the OCR SDK library
member.param: The datapath must be the name of the parent directory of tessdata and must end in / . Any name after the last / will be stripped. NULL will default to current folder.
The language is (usually) an ISO 639-3 string or NULL will default to eng.
Ocr engine mode. See for detail
An array of names of configuration files. Configuration file must be placed in configs or tessconfigs subfolders in dataPath
If true, only params that do not contain "debug" in the name will be set
If true then engine will check the availability of requested language prior initialization.
member.remarks:
Instances are mostly thread-safe and totally independent, but some global parameters remain. Basically it is safe to use multiple OcrApis in different threads in parallel, UNLESS: you use on some of the Params in classify and textord. If you do, then the effect will be to change it for all your instances.
For full list of tesseract variables see this article: That the only members that may be called before Init are those listed below:
It is entirely safe (and eventually will be efficient too) to call Init multiple times on the same instance to change language, or just to reset the classifier.
The language may be a string of the form [~]lang[+[~]lang]* indicating that multiple languages are to be loaded.Eg hin+eng will load Hindi and English.Languages may specify internally that they want to be loaded with one or more other languages, so the ~sign is available to override that.Eg if hin were set to load eng by default, then hin+~eng would force loading only hin.The number of loaded languages is limited only by memory, with the caveat that loading additional languages will impact both speed and accuracy, as there is more work to do to decide on the applicable language, and there is more chance of hallucinating incorrect words.
WARNING: On changing languages, all Tesseract parameters are reset back to their default values. (Which may vary between languages.) If you have a rare need to set a Variable that controls initialization for a second call to Init you should explicitly call and then use SetVariable before Init.This is only a very rare use case, since there are very few uses that require any parameters to be set before Init.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.GetTextFromImage(System.String)
member.summary: Recognize a rectangle from an image and return the result as a string.
member.returns: The recognized text which is coded as UTF8.
member.remarks:
May be called many times for a single Init. Currently has no error checking. Greyscale of 8 and color of 24 or 32 bits per pixel may be given. Palette color images will not work properly and must be converted to 24 bit. Binary images of 1 bit per pixel may also be given but they must be byte packed with the MSB of the first byte being the first pixel, and a 1 represents WHITE. For binary images set bytes_per_pixel= 0.
Note that TesseractRect is the simplified convenience interface. For advanced uses, use , (optionally), , and one or more of the Get*Text functions.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.SetImage(Patagames.Ocr.OcrPix)
member.summary: Provide an image for Tesseract to recognize.

remarks.para: Format of image is as .
Does not copy the image buffer, or take ownership

The source image may be destroyed after is called, either explicitly or implicitly via one of the Get* Text functions. SetImage clears all recognition results, and sets the rectangle to the full image, so it may be followed immediately by a , and it will automatically perform recognition.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.AnalyseLayout
member.summary: Runs page layout analysis in the mode set by .
member.returns: Returns an iterator to the results or throw an exception on any error or an empty page.
member.remarks:
May optionally be called prior to Recognize to get access to just the page layout results. If merge_similar_words is true, words are combined where suitable for use with a line recognizer.Use if you want to use AnalyseLayout to find the textlines, and then want to process textline fragments with an external line recognizer.
WARNING! This class points to data held within the TessBaseAPI class, and therefore can only be used while the TessBaseAPI class still exists and has not been subjected to a call of , , , , or anything else that changes the internal PAGE_RES.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.Recognize
member.summary: Recognize the image from , generating Tesseract internal structures.
member.remarks: Optional. The Get*Text functions will call Recognize if needed. After Recognize, the output is kept internally until the next .

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.RecognizeForChopTest
member.summary: Variant on Recognize used for testing chopper

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.ProcessPages(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Patagames.Ocr.OcrResultRenderer)
member.summary: Turns images into symbolic text.
member.param: filename can point to a single image, a multi-page TIFF, or a text file which contain plain text list of image filenames.
retryConfig is useful for debugging. If not NULL, you can fall back to an alternate configuration if a page fails for some reason.
timeout(milliseconds) terminates processing if any single page takes too long. Set to 0 for unlimited time.
renderer is responible for creating the output. For example, use the if you want plaintext output, or the to produce searchable PDF.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.ProcessPage(Patagames.Ocr.OcrPix,System.String,System.Int32,Patagames.Ocr.OcrResultRenderer)
member.summary: Turn a single image into symbolic text.
member.param: The pix is the image processed.
retryConfig is useful for debugging. If not NULL, you can fall back to an alternate configuration if a page fails for some reason.
timeout(milliseconds) terminates processing if any single page takes too long. Set to 0 for unlimited time.
renderer is responible for creating the output. For example, use the if you want plaintext output, or the to produce searchable PDF.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.AdaptToWordStr(Patagames.Ocr.Enums.PageSegMode,System.String)
member.summary: Applies the given word to the adaptive classifier if possible
member.param: PageSegMode should be PSM_SINGLE_WORD or PSM_CIRCLE_WORD
The word must be SPACE-DELIMITED l i k e t h i s
member.returns: false if adaption was not possible for some reason
member.remarks: The word must be SPACE-DELIMITED UTF-8 - l i k e t h i s , so it can tell the boundaries of the graphemes. Assumes that / have been used to set the image to the given word.The mode arg should be PSM_SINGLE_WORD or PSM_CIRCLE_WORD, as that will be used to control layout analysis. The currently set PageSegMode is preserved.

member.name: M:Patagames.Ocr.OcrApi.IsValidWord(System.String)
member.summary: Check whether a word is valid according to Tesseract's language model
member.returns: False if the word is invalid, true if valid.
